image.altText: A woman uses her phone outside an Optus store as a man looks at his.

props.synopsis: Optus has been slammed by state and federal governments over the Thursday network outage that has been linked to three deaths — including an eight-week-old boy — and caused hundreds of triple-0 emergency calls to fail.

title.children: Optus 'let Australians down' during outage linked to deaths, minister says

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: It's been two days since three people died after a devastating Optus outage caused hundreds of emergency calls to fail, but information about the incident remains scarce.

title.children: What we know about the Optus outage linked to three deaths

image.altText: Two men, one holding a eucalypt tree cutting, stand on a walking track trimmed with gum trees.

props.synopsis: A unique partnership between an artist and a botanist has resulted in an old rail corridor in South Australia becoming an eucalypt forest.

title.children: Forest rail trail grows from artist and tree scientist's seedling deal

image.altText: A man wears a pink cap, LGBTQIA+ badges pinned to his t-shirt. He stands next to a river

props.synopsis: Since homosexuality was decriminalised in South Australia half a century ago, LGBTIQA+ people say the state has made strides, but there is still some way to go towards equality.

title.children: South Australians reflect on life, 50 years after homosexuality was decriminalised

image.altText: A varroa mite on its host, a bee pupa.

props.synopsis: PIRSA says there is a chance the deadly parasite remains in the state where it was detected for the first time earlier this month.

title.children: Infected hives removed but varroa could still be in SA, authority says

image.altText: Premier Peter Malinauskas standing with his ministers at Government House.

props.synopsis: Two resigning ministers, two major broken promises and an unfolding ecological crisis confront SA Labor six months out from a state election. Yet it's the Liberal Party staring down electoral punishment.

title.children: Labor reshuffles its furniture as the Liberals try to save what’s left

image.altText: Close up image of a concrete kerb and open drain on a suburban street

props.synopsis: An Adelaide man who emptied drums containing hazardous chemicals into a suburban gutter — causing nearby residents to experience headaches and nausea — has been fined thousands of dollars.

title.children: Man fined for pouring 'volatile' chemicals into suburban gutter

image.altText: A half demolition Willyama High School.

props.synopsis: Nearly two years after a mould-infested high school was closed indefinitely, high-risk friable asbestos has caused further delays to its demolition.

title.children: Demolition of mould-infested high school halted by asbestos find

image.altText: Foam at an Adelaide beach amid an algal bloom.

props.synopsis: Authorities have told a group of residents living near a metropolitan Adelaide beach to close their doors and windows to prevent symptoms related to South Australia's ongoing algal bloom.

title.children: SA beach residents given 'additional advice' amid algal bloom crisis

image.altText: A white and orange sign saying Bedford, outside a square white building, a wide road with speed breaker in between.

props.synopsis: The federal disability minister says his concerns about Australia's second-largest disability employment provider, Bedford, have grown.

title.children: Disability provider's finances 'more dire than expected'

image.altText: Matthew Draganoff in front of a Union Jack flag

props.synopsis: A man who was found guilty of the "execution-style murder" of his "unarmed" tenant on the northern outskirts of Adelaide has been jailed for at least 28 years.

title.children: Landlord who murdered tenant sentenced to at least 28 years in prison

image.altText: The headquarters of oil and gas company Santos.

props.synopsis: The investment arm of Abu Dhabi's state-owned oil company has dropped its $30 billion takeover bid for Santos.

title.children: Abu Dhabi consortium drops $30b bid to take over Santos

image.altText: Susan Goodwin smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: The family of suspected murder victim Susan Goodwin has issued a statement thanking authorities following the discovery of remains in a Port Lincoln backyard on Wednesday afternoon. A 64-year-old man has appeared in court charged with her alleged murder.

title.children: Family of suspected murder victim Susan Goodwin gives 'heartfelt thank you'

image.altText: A primary school student's class photo when they are 13. They wear a blue coloured sports shirt

props.synopsis: Alliyah is reckoning with a decade of grooming and abuse at the hands of a trusted teacher.

title.children: Alliyah 'married' their teacher at 13. No-one else knew

props.synopsis: Three MiG-31 fighter jets entered its airspace without permission and stayed there for a total of 12 minutes, Estonia's foreign minister said.

title.children: Russian warplanes intercepted in NATO airspace over Estonia

image.altText: A green sign reading "Monash IVF" and "Monash Ultrasound for women"

props.synopsis: Patients have been left blindsided by Monash IVF's decision to temporarily halt treatments using donated eggs and sperm in New South Wales.

title.children: Donor treatment pause over five-family limit leaves patients blindsided

image.altText: Jimmy Kimmel waving while wearing a suit on a red carpet.

props.synopsis: The ABC has received hundreds of complaints about US talk show Jimmy Kimmel Live! being pulled off air and threats to boycott sponsors ... but that's the problem when two broadcasters from different countries share a name!

title.children: Confused complaints to ABC Australia reveal anger over Jimmy Kimmel

image.altText: A graphic composed of three businessmen around a crumbling golden egg.

props.synopsis: As questions mount about how Australia's retirement funds industry is regulated, a senator says regulator ASIC must more quickly and forcefully enforce the law.

title.children: 'Protect your savings': Senators call for super regulation overhaul

image.altText: Donald and Melania walking on the tarmac at the airport

props.synopsis: The UN's role in areas beyond diplomacy, such as in humanitarian aid and refugees, cultural heritage, health, and climate, are all under assault from savage budget cuts.

title.children: UN meeting will test whether the world is at Donald Trump's mercy

image.altText: A large LNG tank sits among mangrove trees, Darwin's skyline is visible in the background

props.synopsis: Secrecy around a major methane leak helped Santos avoid public scrutiny for years. It backfired after a prospective bidder reportedly found out via an ABC News report.

title.children: Secrecy over gas leak backfires as $36b Santos takeover scuttled

image.altText: Donald Trump looking up and to the right, wearing a suit, at a press conference lectern.

props.synopsis: The US president's $US15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times has been labelled "improper" by a federal judge.

title.children: Judge throws out Trump's New York Times lawsuit

image.altText: a police officer addresses media

props.synopsis: Police were called to two separate domestic-related incidents in New South Wales overnight.

title.children: Man dies during alleged DV arrest in Sydney's south west

image.altText: A group of five Afghan girls stand smiling in the grass.

props.synopsis: After fleeing Afghanistan, many refugees in Pakistan are at risk of being deported back amid a crackdown on temporary cardholders as they wait for humanitarian visas from Australia.

title.children: Afghans in Pakistan caught between Australia's delays and local crackdown

image.altText: Steve Pountney and his family living in a bus in bushland in Perth's south-east 2025-08-20 08:08:00

props.synopsis: A Perth man who has been sleeping rough in a bus with his family for the past three years wonders if he would be better off with a roof over his head and regular meals in jail.

title.children: 'Don't throw your camping gear out': Family living in bus losing hope

image.altText: Children sitting on the floor eat meals from silver trays.

props.synopsis: Over 800 students fall sick in two cases of mass food poisoning in one week after consuming free school meals sponsored by the Indonesian government.

title.children: Indonesian students suffer mass food poisoning from free school meals

image.altText: Sussan Ley press conference

props.synopsis: The opposition leader survived a bruising post-election fight that left conservatives seething and has been left with no natural allies.

title.children: Opposition leaders can have slow starts but Sussan Ley doesn't have much time

image.altText: Jess Hull flicks her hair

props.synopsis: Jess Hull was concerned that a focus on the 800m was potentially hurting her endurance. Instead, her "side quest" could lead to a second world championship medal.

title.children: How Jess Hull's 'side quest' could lead to even greater glory

image.altText: British couple released from detention by Taliban arrive in Doha

props.synopsis: The couple, who ran a charity in Afghanistan where they had lived for 18 years, were freed after months of negotiations with the Taliban by Qatar in coordination with Britain.

title.children: British couple freed from Afghanistan's Taliban

image.altText: A Commonwealth Bank branch in Melbourne's CBD

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth Bank originally estimated the planned maintenance would mean some features would be unavailable until about 9am AEST — but it took longer than expected.

title.children: Why was CommBank down this morning?

image.altText: A well dressed elderly man in brown suit, hat and bowtie holds pipe in mouth with left hand and stares out to a river.

props.synopsis: Victor Caulfield packed up his Australian home and moved to Italy, where he fell into the art scene as an accidental model.

title.children: Life after divorce for this man meant moving to Florence in his 70s

image.altText: A regal-looking sandstone court building.

props.synopsis: A police officer has suffered minor injuries after allegedly being tasered while attempting to carry out an arrest in Bathurst, New South Wales.

title.children: Police officer allegedly tasered during arrest attempt

image.altText: A netballer leans forward and catches the ball as a defender closes in behind her.

props.synopsis: A Queensland community is reaping the rewards of establishing the first regional professional netball team in the national league.

title.children: One-of-a-kind pro netball team drives surge in player registration

image.altText: A tray of just-baked sticky chicken wings on a tray, sprinkled with chopped parsley and ready for serving.

props.synopsis: It’s easy to make these irresistibly sticky wings that will have you licking your fingers and reaching for more.

title.children: One-tray honey chicken wings are an easy family dinner

image.altText: The four members of Pink Floyd pose for a publicity photo outside.

props.synopsis: Pink Floyd looked to the past to find a way forward after the massive success of Dark Side Of The Moon in 1973. The result was Wish You Were Here, released 50 years ago this week.

title.children: Pink Floyd's ode to Syd Barrett Wish You Were Here turns 50

image.altText: Flatback turtle

props.synopsis: GPS tracking, motion sensors and video cameras reveal where flatback turtles in Broome's Roebuck Bay feed and travel, contributing to a richer understanding of the vulnerable species.

title.children: World-first tracking shows the ocean from a turtle's point of view
